supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is in a poor state of preservation. The bookblock has been damaged by humidity, especially in the lower outer margins, causing the deformation of the parchment support in correspondence of the outer corners and the formation of dark spots, possibly mould (e.g. ) Stains of various origins are present both on the leather cover and the bookblock (e.g. ). The sewing is broken and so are the headband tiedowns. is becoming detached from the bookblock. The leather cover is abraded in several points.

decoNote.desc:
God the Father.
እግዚአብሔር።

God creates life and the elements of the world (fire; water; earth; air) as angels praise him.
እግዚአብሔር። ሰማይ። / እሳት። / ነፍስ። / መሬት። / ማይ።

God the Father, flanked by Michael and Gabriel, casts the devil out of heaven and binds him.
እግዚአብሔር። ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ቅዱስ፡ ገብርኤል። ዲያብሎስ።

God the Father binds the angels in Hell.
እግዚአብሔር። ገጸ፡ ሰብእ፡ / ገጸ፡ ንስር። / ገጸ፡ አንበሳ። / ገጸ፡ ላህም። አጋንንት

God the Father creates Adam in his likeness.
እግዚአብሔር። አዳም፡ እሳት። / ነፋስ። / መሬት። / ማይ።

God the Father creates Eve from Adam's rib in a garden with flowers.
አዳም፡ ሔዋን፡ እግዚአብሔር።

Two scenes: Eve and Adam share the forbidden taken from a fig tree with the serpent coiled around it (left); the pair are cast out of Eden by an angel (right).
ከይሲ፡ አዳም። ሔዋን፡ መልአክ፡

God the Father looks down upon Adam and Eve, who are shown ashamed of their nakedness to the left and clothed to the right.
ዘከመ፡ ተዓርቁ፡ እምልብስ፡ አዳም፡ ወሔዋን አዳም። ሔዋን፡

Three episodes from top left to bottom right: Cain and Abel offer gifts to god (above); Cain kills his brother (bottom left); he encounters a crow while wondering (bottom right).
አቤል፡ / መሥዋዕት፡ / እሳት፡ ቃየል ዘከመ፡ ቀተሎ፡ ቃየል፡ ለአቤል። አቤል፡ ቃየል / ቋዕ፡

God instructs on how to invoke his name as looks at the recumbent body of his dead brother .
እግዚአብሔር። ሄኖክ፡ ሴት፤ አቤል፡

Jared and his children are shown above, while below the children of Seth descend from the Mount of the Treasures to meet the wives of Cain, one of whom is a giant.
ያሬድ። እግዚአብሔር። ዘከመ፡ ወረዱ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ሴት፡ እምደብር።

God, who sits on a cloak that symbolizes his blessing, addresses Enoch in a garden with trees and flowers.
ሄኖክ፡ / እግዚአብሔር። / መልአክ።

God, who holds a gold orb, grants a long life to Methuselah who prays towards him with a group of elders, presumably his children.
ማቱሳላ፡ / እግዚአብሔር፡ / መላእክት፤

The Ark of Noah described as a tābot and filled with humans, cattle, horses, domesticated animals, and wild beasts. A second group of people are drowning.
ኖኅ። / እግዚአብሔር፡ / ታቦት፤ / ሰብእ። / እንስሳ። አራዊት፤ ማየ፡ አይኅ።

God decides to dwell in the house of Shem, which is represented like a tent, rather than in that of Japhet or Ham.
ካም፡ / ያፌት፤ / ብእሲቱ ሴም፡ እግዚአብሔር። ሐይመት፡

God entrusts Adam’s tomb to Melchizedek and appoints him as a priest.
መልከ፡ ጼዴቅ። እግዚአብሔር። መቃብረ፡ አዳም።

God readies himself to scatter the people who are building the Tower of Babel.
ጥቅመ፡ ስናዖር። እግዚአብሔር።

God calls , who is accompanied by his wife , to the land of , which is populated with trees and located between two rivers.
ሳራ፡ / አብርሃም፡ እግዚአብሔር። ፪ቱ፡ አፍላግ።

God, placed between the two columns of text, looks at the five cities of the plain engulfed by fires (above); Lot and his daughters and wife, who turns back, are guided away by the two angels (below).
እግዚአብሔር። ሎት፡ ዘከመ፡ ኮነት፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ሐውልት፡ ፄው፡ ሶበ፡ ተመይጠት፡ ድኅሬሃ፡ ሎት፡ ፪ኤ፡ አዋልዲሁ፡ ዘከመ፡ መርህዎ፡ መላእክት።

Two scenes: gives one of her slaves to (left); the pair look at the newly born Isaac (right).
እግዚአብሔር። ሳራ፡ / አብርሃም፡ ሳራ፡ / ይስሐቅ። / አብርሃም፡ ንብቲራ፡

The Binding of Isaac.
እግዚአብሔር። አብርሃም፡ ይስሐቅ። በግዕ፡ ዕፀ፡ ስቤቅ፡ አብርሃም፡ ይስሐቅ።

Through the intervention of Michael the Archangel neither Esau nor Laban harm Jacob, who is depicted in front of a tent, together with his two wives and his large flock of animals.
ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል። ኤሳው። ላባ፡ ሐይመት። ራሔል / ያዕቆብ / ለያ አፍራስ / አግማል፡ / አባግዕ፡ / አድግት፡

The devil tests Job.
እግዚአብሔር። ኢዮብ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ለኢዮብ፤ ሕማሙ፡ ለኢዮብ፡ ጎፍር፡ ኤልፉዝ፡ በልዳዶስ።

item.desc: Note written in brownish ink on the upper margin of the incipit page of . It states that the book belongs to manuscript collection of

Several white stickers are glued on the inner side of the front cover. On the rightmost is printed ‘H. Kevorkian collection’, with the number ‘623’ added in pencil. On the following sticker are written in blue pen the numbers ‘1977’ and ‘18’, above a previous signature ‘MS Et 16’ in black ink. On the leftmost is printed the name of (ቤንት፡ ዩውል፡ የንሰን።), with the signature ‘MS. Aeth. d. 16’ added in pencil. Below, a further sticker is glued with the shelfmark ‘Ms 36’ printed on it. The inner side of the front cover and of the front board also bear three barely legible black stamps.
Two white stickers are glued on the inner side of the back board. On the right one is written ‘489’ in black pen, on the left one is printed the number ‘1067’.

binding.p: The sewing has been repaired. However, most of the binding is likely contemporary to the manuscript content.
binding.decoNote: The book is bound in wooden boards, fully covered with reddish-brown blind-tooled leather.
The boards are slightly larger than the bookblock.

Full reddish-brown blind-tooled leather cover. The turn-ins have been trimmed out, and they form butt mitres at the corners. The external surfaces of the cover show a fine blind-tooled decoration. The decoration consists of seven concentric frames surrounding a central rectangular panel featuring a Latin cross. Frames composed by the repetition of single tools, enclosed between triple straight lines, alternate with empty ones. Proceeding from the outer to the inner frame, the repeating decoration motifs are criss-crosses, double X-forms, wavy lines, and curve strapwork elements. straight strapwork elements. The cross is formed by X-form motifs between triple straight lines. At the ends of the arms of the cross there are pairs of crescents disposed to resemble a corniform motif and three double circles. Triple straight lines divide the area around the cross in four panels, outlining the shape of the cross. Double circles are also stamped at the intersection of the triple straight lines. On the spine, triple straight lines intersect, forming a diamond pattern.
Chainstitch sewing on four sewing stations (two pairs); periodic fold pattern; Z-plied threads. Between each pair of sewing stations, there are two thread lengths.
The spine is formed by two overlapping layers of leather. The endbands are sewn through the first layer so that the tiedowns are hidden under the second layer.
